intro: Angostura alipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved angostura, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Angostura alipes is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
